title: What British people get wrong about Halloween (according to an American mum)
text:
This is the most awkward week of the year to be an American in Britain. While Trump and his team do their best to court derision and disdain year-round, it’s during the approach to October 31 that my otherwise open-minded British friends sneer and curse the 50 United States that have so polluted this small island with the one-night holiday that is Hallowe’en.

According to a poll last year, the nation is evenly split between those friendly to this “American import” and those who would rather abstain. Yet Britain goes bigger on Hallowe’en each year, and to no good end. Over £400 million was spent on Halloween in the UK last year, with shops and ­supermarkets starting promotions weeks before the...
